answers.answer: Unless there is a medical reason, I really doubt it. Some doctors might, but that's not the type of doctor I would personally want.

Well I know I won't go full term because my Dr told me since I had preeclampsia the first time so bad that I will most likely have it again, she said itd be safer to take the baby sooner then later .. so I guess I will wait till I get further along to figure that out..

I think unless you have preeclampsia the hospitals won't let you have the baby any earlier than 39 weeks. The March of Dimes has pushed to regulate this because too many Drs are taking babies too early. The long lager the baby stays in utero the better off the baby is. Don't rush it unless its medically necessary!
The longer the baby stays in utero

Um the earliest I've heard of it being done is 38 weeks unless baby is in danger then I've heard 33weeks.. You can ask but really unless your fluid gets low most doctors don't like to do it until 38 weeks
Your not due till February. I really doubt your dr. Will schedule you for 37 week c-section right now based on the fact that you might get preclampsia but your not even in your 3rd trimester yet.

I delivered my youngest at 37w1d but that was cause I went into labor and it was my 3rd c/section. They aren't going to do it for no reason, 39 weeks is the usual anywhere. And your not even in your third trimester yet don't worry about that yet
i had my c-section, planned, scheduled at 37 weeks, but it wasn't until 39 weeks that I did it, he gave me the option of 38 weeks and 4 days and i said no

Not too likely, just because your considered full term doesn't mean they are done cooking, basically the only difference is if you make it to full term ( 36 weeks) if you go into labor they won't stop you. Unless you are at risk or your baby is at risk they won't induce you till after your due date there is still huge differences between babies born on or after their due date and babies born even just a week early. Just let that little guy cook, every day counts

question: How likely is it that I can be induced at 37+3  for my c-section... My Dr already knows that I am having a second c-section and I'm really going to try to push for a c-section at 37+3 at my next appt. I know they will let you get one at 38 weeks so what is four days sooner.. wish me luck haha
title: just a question..
